required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carotenoid Response to the Intake of Vegetables and Fruits
clinical_study.official_title: Skin Carotenoid Response to Intake of Vegetables and Fruits Recommended by the Dietary Guidelines

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to validate the non-invasive tool, resonance Raman spectroscopy for assessing vegetable and fruit consumption.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will validate the use of resonance Raman spectroscopy to assess vegetable and fruit intake by performing a controlled feeding study during which volunteers will consume a provided diet with known amounts of carotenoids in the form of fruits and vegetables.

primary_outcome.measure: Serum and skin levels of carotenoids in adults fed a high carotenoid diet

clinical_study.condition: Resonance Raman Spectroscopy for Dietary Carotenoid Intake

arm_group.description: Skin carotenoids will be measured under conditions of depletion or repletion

intervention.description: Depletion of carotenoids using a restricted food list
Carotenoid repletion with provided diet based on dietary guidelines.
Carotenoid depletion using a restricted food list.
Resumption of usual personal diet regimen. No restrictions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women aged 18 - 65 years
- Weight stable (Â±5 lbs) for at least 2 months prior to the start of the study
- Body mass index (BMI) between 19-30 kg/m2
- Willing to refrain from the use of nicotine and dietary supplements for the duration of the study
- Willing to maintain baseline weight and physical activity levels
Exclusion Criteria:
1. BMI greater than 30.
2. Gastrointestinal disorders, disease, or medication that affects carotenoid absorption or storage
3. Current smoker
4. Allergies or intolerances to foods to be utilized in the study
5. Consumption of greater than an average of 1 alcoholic drink/day for women and 2/day for men, use of nutritional/sports supplements (if unwilling to discontinue during the study)
6. Pregnancy or lactating

overall_official.affiliation: Agricultural Research Service, United States Department of Agriculture, Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

facility.name: Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

link.description: Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center
